question: How to make a Fried Cherry Pie on your stovetop.
option1: r 1 1/4 cup flour and 1/4 tsp. salt.  Using a pastry blender cut 1/3 cup shortening until pieces are pea sized.  Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of cold water over mixture, toss with a fork.  Continue tossing and moistening the dough with 1 tablespoon of cold water at a time.  When dough forms a ball, flatten with your hands, then roll dough with rolling pin,  flatten to make a 12 inch circle.  Out of this make as many 5 inch circles as possible.  In each circle place about 1/2 cup of canned cherry pie filling.  Fold in half over pudding, crimp edges.  Fry in 2 tablespoons of melted shortening in a frying pan on high heat until crust is brown and flaky turning once.
option2: r 1 1/4 cup flour and 1/4 tsp. salt.  Using a pastry blender cut 1/3 cup shortening until pieces are pea sized.  Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of cold water over mixture, toss with a fork.  Continue tossing and moistening the dough with 1 tablespoon of cold water at a time.  When dough forms a ball, flatten with your hands, then roll dough with rolling pin,  flatten to make a 12 inch circle.  Out of this make as many 5 inch circles as possible.  In each circle place about 1/2 cup of canned cherry pie filling.  Fold in half over pudding, crimp edges.  Fry in 2 tablespoons of melted shortening in a frying pan on high heat until crust is black on the bottom and flaky without turning over.

question: Easy non toxic finger painting fun for the kids.

question: how to treat peeling skin
option1: Rub sliced cucumber over your peeling skin. Bring your skin in contact with the light green flesh of the cucumber, not the dark green skin. Hold the slices against your skin for about 20 minutes and rinse off with warm water. Repeat as often as you’d like until your peeling skin starts improving
option2: Rub sliced onions coated with ketchup over your skin. Bring your skin in contact with the light green flesh of the cucumber, not the dark green skin. question: Feed 4 people for $5.
option1: Coconut curry is a great example of thrifty but delicious cooking. Ingredients: can coconut milk, $1 (dollar store), pack of 2 pork cutlets, $2.50, 2 tspn. of curry paste .25 if you already have it on hand, 1 chicken boullion cube .25, dash of soya sauce, splash of milk or cream, green onions and a carrot. Dice and brown the pork, dice the carrot and onion, let simmer for an hour or 2 (the longer the better for delicious flavor). Serve on rice ($1. or less) And there is your delicious meal for $5. for 4 people. So good, you might even be able to sell the leftovers and make a profit!
option2: Coconut curry is a great example of thrifty but delicious cooking. Ingredients: can coconut milk, $1 (dollar store), pack of 2 pork cutlets, $250.00, 2 tspn. of curry paste .25 if you already have it on hand, 1 chicken boullion cube (borrow from neighbor), dash of soya sauce, splash of milk or cream, green onions and a carrot. Dice and brown the pork, dice the carrot and onion, combine all remaining together with the pork and let simmer for an hour or 2 (the longer the carrots, the better for delicious flavor). Serve on rice ($1. or less) And there is your delicious meal for $5. for 4 people. So good, you might even be able to sell the leftovers and make a profit!

question: How can you use electrical tape in a small space?
option1: When you have to wrap wires with electrical tape in a tight area, pull off a few inches of tape and wrap it tightly on itself around your index finger so the sticky side is in. Then you can just roll the tape around the wire with your thumb, using your middle finger to support it.
option2: When you have to wrap wires with electrical tape in a tight area, pull off a few inches of tape and wrap it loosely on itself around your index finger so the sticky side is out. Then you can just roll the tape around the wire with your thumb, using your middle finger to support it.

question: to assess if your refrigerator door seal needs to be replaced
option1: Put the index card between the refrigerator door and refrigerator, and close the door on it. Then, try to pull it out slowly. If you feel it drag slightly, your gasket doesn’t need replacing. If it slips out quickly or has moisture on it or mold, get a new gasket.
option2: Put the dollar bill between the refrigerator door and refrigerator, and close the door on it. Then, try to pull it out slowly. If you feel it drag slightly, your gasket doesn’t need replacing. If it slips out quickly or has moisture on it or mold, get a new gasket.
